analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: For example, etc. is an example of the Sutra school, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: There, etc. is also an expression.

original: gal te sh'a ri'i bu 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bsgrubs pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: gal te sh'a ri'i bu 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bsgrubs pa'i phan yon no //
translated: If, son of good family, there were a Jambudvipa, etc. up to the Buddha and the qualities of the Buddha, this is the benefit of accomplishment.

original: phan yon dang bcas pa'i sgrub pa'i gdams ngag rgya cher bstan no //
analyzed: phan yon dang bcas pa'i sgrub pa'i gdams ngag rgya cher bstan no //
translated: The instruction in accomplishment together with its benefit has been taught extensively.

original: da ni bden pa'i gdams ngag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bden pa'i gdams ngag brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the instruction in the truth should be stated.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar ldan pa dang / rab tu ldan par 'gyur ba de ltar bden pa'i gdams ngag ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar ldan pa dang / rab tu ldan par 'gyur ba de ltar bden pa'i gdams ngag ston par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches the instructions on the truths in such a way that the bodhisattva will be endowed with and well endowed with those.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩde bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas / de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: With regard to the truth of suffering, it is said:

original: ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya bar yang dag par mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya bar yang dag par mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal kho na shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal kho na shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the truth of suffering is not just suffering that is to be known,

original: 'on kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag kyang ngo //
translated: but also the four noble truths.

original: de dag gis kyang chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus te /
translated: They also perfectly encompass all phenomena.

original: des na phung @86b po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: des na phung @86b po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, sense bases, truths and dependent origination

original: de rnams kyi dbye bas tshogs lngar byas te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye bas tshogs lngar byas te /
translated: are classified as the five collections.

original: de dag gi stong pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa la yang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi stong pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa la yang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: And their emptiness, the emptiness of the internal, etc. should be said to be endowed and not endowed.

original: de tsam kho na yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de tsam kho na yang ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe de dag la ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du ji ltar yang mi mthong ba de'i tshe ldan pa zhes brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe de dag la ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du ji ltar yang mi mthong ba de'i tshe ldan pa zhes brjod par bya ba ste /

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction on the truth of suffering.üîΩWith regard to the truth of origination, it is said:

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas de la gzugs med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /üîΩrnam par shes pa nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas de la gzugs med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / rnam par shes pa nyid stong pa'o //
translated: Form is empty.üîΩEmptiness is form.üîΩConsciousness is empty.

original: stong pa nyid rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: Emptiness is consciousness.

original: de ltar na kun 'byung spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun 'byung spang bar bya'o //

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa de las 'byung ba ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ma yin te des na ji ltar kun 'byung yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa de las 'byung ba ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ma yin te des na ji ltar kun 'byung yin /
translated: Because form, etc. do not arise from that, it is not a cause, and so how can it be origination?

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i chos can ma yin pa de ji ltar spang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i chos can ma yin pa de ji ltar spang bar bya ba yin /

original: ji ltar 'di ma spangs pas ni 'ga' yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ma spangs pas ni 'ga' yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /

original: spangs pas ni 'ga' yang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: spangs pas ni 'ga' yang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it is abandoned, then no one would be purified.

original: 'di ji ltar spang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar spang bar bya ba yin /
translated: So how could it be something to be abandoned?

original: ci ste sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dag dang ldan pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dag dang ldan pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin la /

original: mi ldan pa ni rnam par dag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni rnam par dag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and being dissociated from them is purification,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that also is illogical.

original: 'di ltar des gang zhig gang du yang dag par 'du zhing ldan par ma mthong ba de ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la gdams pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang zhig gang du yang dag par 'du zhing ldan par ma mthong ba de ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la gdams pa'o /
translated: Thus, when one does not see anything that is associated with anything, that is instruction in the truth of origination.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩsh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas nas / sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid ces bya ba nas /
translated: With regard to the truth of cessation,üîΩthe sutra says:

original: ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, emptiness is not associated with anything.‚Äù

original: don ni 'di yin te byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong na /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong na /
translated: The meaning is as follows: If the bodhisattva sees all phenomena as emptiness,

original: de la gang gis 'gog pa mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: de la gang gis 'gog pa mngon sum du bya /
translated: then what would he realize as cessation?

original: de la re zhig de nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig de nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not that very emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: as stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúEmptiness is not a view.‚Äù

original: de ni mi skye mi 'gag ste /
analyzed: de ni mi skye mi 'gag ste /
translated: It is not produced and does not cease,

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro // kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
translated: because it is permanent.üîΩIt is not defiled

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and is not purified,

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i @87a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i @87a * //
translated: because it is immutable.

original: phyir ro // bri bar mi 'gyur 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir ro // bri bar mi 'gyur 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not decrease and does not increase,

original: khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pervasive.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is not past, etc.,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent, etc.

original: des na yang sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa las phyis rnam par byang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yang sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa las phyis rnam par byang ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that later it is purified after being defiled earlier.

original: gal te sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dag de la 'gog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dag de la 'gog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that suffering and its origin are its cessation,

original: gang yang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, Whatever is like this... and so forth.üîΩ

original: khyab pa 'di la gzugs la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab pa 'di la gzugs la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that there is no form, etc.

original: des na sdug bsngal med do //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no suffering.

original: kun 'byung med do zhes bya ba nas byang chub med do zhes bya ba'i bar ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung med do zhes bya ba nas byang chub med do zhes bya ba'i bar ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: There is no origination, up to there is no enlightenment, is the instruction on the truth of cessation.

original: de la lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of the truth of the path, it is said:

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom, up to

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, with four phrases.

original: de ltar na lam bsgom par bya ba ni gang gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba ni gang la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rnams yod pa de ni lam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam bsgom par bya ba ni gang gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba ni gang la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rnams yod pa de ni lam yin no //
translated: Thus, the path to be cultivated is that by which suffering is to be fully known, origination is to be abandoned, cessation is to be realized, and the path is to be cultivated. That in which the dharmas of the fruits of training and post-training exist is the path.

original: des na lam 'khor dang bcas pa des ni chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na lam 'khor dang bcas pa des ni chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the path together with its retinue includes all dharmas.

original: de dag mi dmigs pa dang / bdag ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa nyid du dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pa dang / bdag ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa nyid du dmigs pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of those, and the apprehension of the self as endowed and as not endowed,

original: de ni sbyor ba gcig go //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba gcig go //
translated: this is the single application.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa dag gis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa dag gis te /
translated: In the cultivation of the samadhis of emptiness, etc., it is by means of emptiness, etc.,

original: rang gi ngo bo kun brtags pa dag gis mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kun brtags pa dag gis mi sbyor ro //

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor rnams la yang de'i sbyong ba'i sgras kyang mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor rnams la yang de'i sbyong ba'i sgras kyang mi sbyor ro //

original: mi sbyor mi 'byed ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: mi sbyor mi 'byed ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mi sbyor ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdoes not unite, does not divide‚Äù means that it does not unite because it lacks the characteristic of imagined union.

original: rang nyid brjod du med cing mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir mi 'byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid brjod du med cing mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir mi 'byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: It does not divide because it is itself inexpressible and the essence of signless samadhi. This is the second.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor te /

original: de la de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid sgom par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro // de nyid sgom par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not have that intrinsic identity.üîΩIt is not differentiated because it is the meditation on that very thing.

original: 'byed par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'byed par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third.

original: bzhi pa @87b ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa @87b ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The fourth is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction on the truth of the path.

original: dkon mchog gsum la gdams ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la gdams ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The instruction on the Three Jewels should be explained.

original: de la sangs rgyas dkon mchog la gdams pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dkon mchog la gdams pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of the instruction on the Jewel of the Buddha,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis gsungs so //
translated: it is said by the words ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.

analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: ‚Äù Thus, the knowledge of all aspects is buddhahood.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid thob //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid thob //

original: rin chen snod ni phye ba ltar //
analyzed: rin chen snod ni phye ba ltar //

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni yang dag bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni yang dag bstan //
translated: buddhahood is truly taught.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is explained.

original: des na phung po dang skye mched rnams ni dbye ba ma mthong bas de la nges mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gcig go //
analyzed: des na phung po dang skye mched rnams ni dbye ba ma mthong bas de la nges mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gcig go //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates and the sense-fields are not to be connected with the determination, since their division is not seen. This is one application.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lam 'di'i 'bras bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lam 'di'i 'bras bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of giving, etc. are the result of this path. This is the second.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi sbyor ro //

original: de yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub dang mi sbyor te /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub dang mi sbyor te /
translated: And that is not to be connected with Buddhahood and enlightenment.

original: gsum po dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //

original: chos dkon mchog gi dbang du byas te /üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog gi dbang du byas te / gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: With regard to the Jewel of the Dharma,

analyzed: 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig mang pos gsungs so //

original: de yang sangs rgyas dkon mchog nyid do //

original: lhag ma ni 'dir lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'dir lam gyi bden pa ste /

original: chos dkon mchog go //

analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du bden pa nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'o ;

analyzed: / de la gang las gzugs la sogs pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //

analyzed: des na kun 'byung mi dmigs so //

original: gang gi phyir dngos po yod ces bya bar yang mi sbyor te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po yod ces bya bar yang mi sbyor te /
translated: Because one does not apply the term ‚Äúexists‚Äù to things such as form,

original: des na kun 'byung ba spang bar bya zhes bya ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: des na kun 'byung ba spang bar bya zhes bya ba mi dmigs so //
translated: therefore one does not apprehend the origin as something to be abandoned.

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang de las bzlog pa yang mi dmigs so //

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sgom pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: cultivating the applications of mindfulness and so forth is the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la sogs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la sogs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas te /
translated: Dwelling in the non-discriminating Dharma through the subsequent knowledge of suffering and so forth,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: cultivating virtuous dharmas is the path of seeing.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena are mere imputations.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur @91b rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur @91b rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not become defiled or purified, because they are non-existent.

original: gang yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNor is there any defilement‚Äù means that there is no origination.

original: gang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bas ni de'i spang bar bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bas ni de'i spang bar bya ba med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNor is there any purification‚Äù means that there is no cessation of that which is to be abandoned.

original: de ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the origination.

original: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni yang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni yang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no attachment to form‚Äù means that there is no further attachment.

original: mngon par chags pa nyid ni dngos su na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa nyid ni dngos su na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is suffering and its origination.

original: de yang de'i tshe shin tu nyam chung ba nyid kyis gnas skabs phyi ma yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe shin tu nyam chung ba nyid kyis gnas skabs phyi ma yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs so //
translated: This is said because it is a later stage, since it is very weak at that time.

original: de yang de ni phung po med do //
analyzed: de yang de ni phung po med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no heap there.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa med do //üîΩde la rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa med do // de la rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no eye, etc.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThere is no consciousness there.‚Äù

original: de la shes pa dang reg pa med do //
analyzed: de la shes pa dang reg pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no knowledge or contact there.‚Äù

original: reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang med do //
analyzed: reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no feeling arising from contact there.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa yang med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no conditioned thing there.‚Äù

original: de spong ba la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de spong ba la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //
translated: He does not become attached to the abandonment of that. This is the dharma knowledge of the origin.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mig dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang bcas pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ba med pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mig dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang bcas pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ba med pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: He does not become attached to the perfections, the eyes, the superknowledges, emptiness, suchness, and so on, and to the maturation of sentient beings. This is the receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of the origin.

original: de ltar de chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rnam par 'phel ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar de chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rnam par 'phel ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, he who is without attachment to all dharmas, through the perfections, enters into the secure state of the bodhisattva.

original: de bas na rnam par byang ba rnams la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par byang ba rnams la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because he subsequently realizes the causes and effects of the purities, it is the subsequent knowledge of the origin.

original: de ltar spyod pa na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i sgrib pa 'gog pas ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i sgrib pa 'gog pas ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: When one practices in this way, one ascends to the stage of nonregression. This is the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to cessation, because it is the cessation of the obscurations.

original: de ltar spyod pa na mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa la sogs pa khyad par du mngon par rtogs pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa na mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa la sogs pa khyad par du mngon par rtogs pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o ;
translated: When one practices in this way, the special clear realization of the fulfillment of the superknowledges, etc. is the cognition of the factors with regard to cessation.

original: / phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams dang / sa la sogs pa khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag la rnam pa lngar byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa med pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: / phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams dang / sa la sogs pa khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag la rnam pa lngar byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa med pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's nonapprehension of the aggregates, the sense bases, the elements, the six elements such as earth, and the members of dependent origination in the fivefold way is the receptivity to the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation.

original: phung po rnams kyi bsdus pa dang / @92a * //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi bsdus pa dang / @92a * //
translated: The aggregates are included in the elements and sense bases.

original: gzugs dang de dag gi khyad par med pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang de dag gi khyad par med pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form and its distinctions are not observed.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma yin pa dang ; de dag gi lam ma yin pa'i bar du bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma yin pa dang ; de dag gi lam ma yin pa'i bar du bstan te /
translated: Similarly, up to consciousness is not, and up to its path is not.

original: de ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is receptivity to the knowledge of the dharmas with regard to the path.

original: gnyis po 'di ni chos dang chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni chos dang chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: These two are the dharma and the dharmadhatu.

original: des na gsungs pa /üîΩchos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo /
analyzed: des na gsungs pa / chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe dharmadhatu is not seen.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: The dharmadhatu does not see the dharma.

original: 'di ni lam la chos shes pa'o //üîΩso sor phung po'i dbyings dang / skye mched kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni lam la chos shes pa'o // so sor phung po'i dbyings dang / skye mched kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: This is the knowledge of the dharmas with regard to the path.üîΩThe dharmadhatu is not seen by the individual aggregates and sense bases.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang de dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //üîΩde ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang de dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // de ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The dharmadhatu does not see them.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: This is receptivity to the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.üîΩWith regard to the subsequent knowledge of the path,

original: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the realm of conditioned phenomena does not see the realm of the unconditioned, and so on up to

original: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: that is the teaching.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon sum du byed cing snang bas na chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa snang ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon sum du byed cing snang bas na chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance of the non-dual is the appearance of the realm of phenomena, because the intrinsic identity of phenomena does not appear.

original: mtha' yas pa snang ba snang ba med pa tsam ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa snang ba snang ba med pa tsam ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The mere appearance of the infinite is the characteristic of correct pristine wisdom.

original: de ni 'dus byas kyi khams te /
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas kyi khams te /
translated: That is the realm of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus byas thams cad las phra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad las phra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is more subtle than all conditioned phenomena.

original: de nyid la kun brtags pa'i gzugs la @92b sogs pas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dus ma byas kyi khams te /
analyzed: de nyid la kun brtags pa'i gzugs la @92b sogs pas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dus ma byas kyi khams te /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness with respect to the imagined form and so on in just that is the realm of the unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas ni phra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni phra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the unconditioned is more subtle.

original: de dag ni snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag ni snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the former and the latter.

original: mi 'dzin pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'i don to //
translated: means not apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apprehension is conceptualization.

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pas don dam par mthong bas mthong ba'i lam zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pas don dam par mthong bas mthong ba'i lam zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the path of seeing is called seeing the ultimate through non-conceptual perception?

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNo, etc. ‚Äù

original: de bas na 'dus byas kyi dbyings ma gtogs par 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas kyi dbyings ma gtogs par 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúApart from the realm of the conditioned, the unconditioned realm cannot be designated. ‚Äù

original: de gnyis tha dad na ni 'dus byas kyi khams nyid du snang bar 'gyur te /üîΩsnang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad na ni 'dus byas kyi khams nyid du snang bar 'gyur te / snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ni ma yin te /
translated: If the two were different, the unconditioned realm would appear as the realm of the conditioned,üîΩbecause it would have the nature of appearance.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not that, because it is the opposite of that.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ma gtogs par 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyang rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ma gtogs par 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyang rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: Apart from the unconditioned realm, the conditioned realm cannot be established.

original: stong pa nyid las tha dad na ni stong pa nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las tha dad na ni stong pa nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: If it were different from emptiness, it would follow that it is not emptiness.

original: sngon po nyid las tha dad pa'i ser po ni sngon po ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po nyid las tha dad pa'i ser po ni sngon po ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as yellow, which is different from blue, is not blue.

original: de bas na snang ba'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid kyi mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de bas na snang ba'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid kyi mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: Therefore, the path of seeing is the nonconceptual cognition of emptiness that has the nature of appearance,

original: 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the apprehension of the absence of the duality of subject and object.

original: phyogs 'dis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: By this position, the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering and so forth should be understood to have the nature of the wisdom of nonconceptual emptiness.

original: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi snang ba nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi snang ba nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase does not see any dharma at all means that the appearance of the intrinsic identity of all dharmas has disappeared.

original: 'di ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.üîΩThis is the extensive explanation.

original: 'di nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase does not see form up to does not see consciousness is the teaching.

original: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase this is the teaching is the summary.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction on the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the point of view of the path of cultivation,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

original: chos la sred pa ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: chos la sred pa ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //

translated: purity of equanimity, purity of mindfulness, and purity of the mind are the branches of antidote.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is the branch of benefit.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest are as before.

original: gzugs med pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In terms of the formless, it is said, ‚ÄúSimilarly, the base of infinite space,‚Äù and so on.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the perceptions of form,

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes te /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes te /
translated: the perceptions of obstruction disappear, and not paying attention to the perception of various things, it is infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, having actualized the base of infinite space, one abides.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes ni sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes ni sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of form is the perception of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: de dag la ma chags pa ni de dag thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la ma chags pa ni de dag thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: Non-attachment to those is the complete transcendence of all of them.

original: thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bsgoms pas snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bsgoms pas snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the cultivation of the perception of space everywhere, there is no appearance.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa dang / ra ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa dang / ra ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of obstruction is the perception of obstructions such as walls and fences.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / ri dang / chu bo dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / ri dang / chu bo dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of variety is the perception of mansions, parks, mountains, rivers, the moon, the sun, and so on.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni 'di la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dmigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni 'di la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dmigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite space is so called because it has the sphere of infinite space as its object.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In every way, one completely transcends the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: One establishes and abides in the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking, ‚ÄúConsciousness is infinite.‚Äù

original: ji ltar @106a * //
analyzed: ji ltar @106a * //
translated: How is it?üîΩüîΩ

original: 'di las yang dag par 'das she na /
analyzed: 'di las yang dag par 'das she na /
translated: How is it that he transcends this?

original: de rnam par shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos pa de de nyid mtha' yas pa las grol ba ste /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos pa de de nyid mtha' yas pa las grol ba ste /
translated: By means of that consciousness through which he resolved upon the infinitude of space, he is liberated from that very infinitude.

original: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has completely eliminated the notion of space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In every way he transcends the station of the infinitude of consciousness.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: He attains and dwells in the station of nothingness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas las gyen du bskyod pa'i dmigs pa cung zad kyang mi mthong ba de ni cung zad med pa nyid du dmigs pa byas te snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas las gyen du bskyod pa'i dmigs pa cung zad kyang mi mthong ba de ni cung zad med pa nyid du dmigs pa byas te snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: He does not see even the slightest object that would cause him to rise above the infinitude of consciousness. He attains and dwells in the station of nothingness by taking nothingness as his object.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In every way he transcends the station of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: He attains and dwells in the station of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: cung zad med pa'i 'du shes las kyang chags pa dang bral nas de las kyang zlog par byed de /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i 'du shes las kyang chags pa dang bral nas de las kyang zlog par byed de /
translated: Having become detached from the perception of nothingness, he turns away from that as well.

original: cung zad med pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma nyid nas bzlog pas 'du shes med pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma nyid nas bzlog pas 'du shes med pa'o //
translated: Since he turns away from the perception of nothingness, he is without perception.

original: 'du shes phra bar 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes phra bar 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: He enters into subtle perception.

original: des na 'du shes med min no //
analyzed: des na 'du shes med min no //
translated: Therefore, he is neither with nor without perception.

original: gang la 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar 'dzin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: gang la 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar 'dzin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: He is called neither with nor without perception because he takes up the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad po de dag la byang chub sems dpa' nyin re zhing snyoms par zhugs pa de'i sngon dang phyis ni nam mkha'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad po de dag la byang chub sems dpa' nyin re zhing snyoms par zhugs pa de'i sngon dang phyis ni nam mkha'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva enters into these eight liberations and eight bases of mastery every day. Before and after, he attends to the aspects, signs, and characteristics of space.

original: de la chos 'di dag thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'di dag thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Among them, the aspect of space is that all these phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not accept either difference or non-difference.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba nam mkha'i rtags te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba nam mkha'i rtags te /
translated: The sign of space is said to be ‚Äúnon-material, non-apparent, and unobstructing.‚Äù

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to that.

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign of space is said to be ‚Äúuniform in the absence of characteristics.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' lta bur stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears as the sign of emptiness, like space.

original: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one practices the perfection of generosity,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: all the roots of virtue are made common to all sentient beings and dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. In this way, the perfection of generosity is fulfilled.

original: gal te tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When one practices the perfection of morality,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i @106b yid la byed pa gtan du spangs pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i @106b yid la byed pa gtan du spangs pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the abandonment of the mental orientation of the disciples, etc.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma ni go cha drug gi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma ni go cha drug gi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the rest should be understood according to the six modes of the perfections.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni de lta bu'o //
translated: The concentrations and the formless meditative attainments are like that.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug drug gi 'jug pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug drug gi 'jug pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The engagement of the six perfections is according to the sutras.

original: lam la 'jug pa yang mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: lam la 'jug pa yang mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The engagement of the path is also according to the sutras.

original: lam gyi rab tu dbye ba yang lam gyi tshogs nas rnam par 'grel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi rab tu dbye ba yang lam gyi tshogs nas rnam par 'grel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The classification of the path will be explained in the chapter on the equipment of the path.

original: tshad med pa'i rab tu 'jug pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i rab tu 'jug pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The engagement of the immeasurables should be explained.

original: sems can dpag tu med pas dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pas dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they take immeasurable sentient beings as their objects.

original: de ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni bzhi ste /
translated: They are four:

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de la bde ba yang dag par ldan pa'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba yang dag par ldan pa'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: Among them, loving-kindness is the thought endowed with bliss.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the will to remove suffering.

original: bde ba dang mi 'bral ba'i bsam pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi 'bral ba'i bsam pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Sympathetic joy is the will to not be separated from happiness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i bsam pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i bsam pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the will to be free from the addictions.üîΩThe will to have all beings possess happiness, the will to have them be free from suffering, the will to have them not be separated from the joys of the Dharma, and the will to have them possess the great equanimity free from the addictions, is the four immeasurables. üîΩThe four immeasurables are the will to have all beings possess happiness, etc.  The will to have them possess happiness is love.üîΩThe will to have them be free from suffering is compassion.

original: kye ma ma la sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan par smon pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral bar smon pa dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar smon pa dang / nyon mongs pa las grol bar smon pa dang / bzhi po yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma ma la sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan par smon pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral bar smon pa dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar smon pa dang / nyon mongs pa las grol bar smon pa dang / bzhi po yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The will to have them not be separated from the joys of the Dharma is sympathetic joy.üîΩThe will to have them possess the great equanimity free from the addictions is equanimity.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the will to have all beings possess happiness, etc.  The will to have them possess happiness is love.üîΩThe will to have them be free from suffering is compassion.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bdun la ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bdun la ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The will to have them not be separated from the joys of the Dharma is sympathetic joy.

original: de las gong mar gyur pa rnams la ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de las gong mar gyur pa rnams la ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The will to have them possess the great equanimity free from the addictions is equanimity.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the will to have all beings possess happiness, etc.  The will to have them possess happiness is love.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'di tsam gyis ni yon tan dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la / 'di tsam gyis ni yon tan dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: The will to have them be free from suffering is compassion.üîΩThe will to have them not be separated from the joys of the Dharma is sympathetic joy.üîΩThe will to have them possess the great equanimity free from the addictions is equanimity.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the will to have all beings possess happiness, etc.  The will to have them possess happiness is love.

original: lhag mas ni yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: lhag mas ni yon tan bstan to //
translated: The will to have them be free from suffering is compassion.üîΩThe will to have them not be separated from the joys of the Dharma is sympathetic joy.üîΩThe will to have them possess the great equanimity free from the addictions is equanimity.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the will to have all beings possess happiness, etc.  The will to have them possess happiness is love.

original: yangs pa zhes bya bas ni bsam pa chen po bstan to //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya bas ni bsam pa chen po bstan to //
translated: The word vast indicates the great aspiration.

original: chen pos zhes bya bas ni 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: chen pos zhes bya bas ni 'phel ba'o //
translated: The word great indicates the increase.

original: tshad med pas zhes bya bas ni dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: tshad med pas zhes bya bas ni dmigs pa las so //
translated: The word immeasurable indicates the object.

original: mi gnyis pa zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word non-dual indicates the absence of conceptual differentiation due to the identity of self and others.

original: 'gran zla med pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word unrivaled indicates the abandonment of counteragents.

original: de la byams pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni go rims bzhin du gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dag go //
analyzed: de la byams pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni go rims bzhin du gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dag go //
translated: The counteragents to love, etc. are, respectively, malice, violence, lack of joy, and attachment and aversion.

original: lhod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang / rmugs pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang / rmugs pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word uninterrupted indicates the pacification of sleep and laziness.üîΩThe word unobstructed indicates the pacification of excitement and regret.

original: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgnod pa med pa @107a * //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgnod pa med pa @107a * //
translated: The word harmless indicates the pacification of envy and avarice.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsum po de dag nyid kyis sems dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsum po de dag nyid kyis sems dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of those three, the mind is free from stains.

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ni bshes dang dgra dang tha mal pa gsum po dag la yang dag par rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ni bshes dang dgra dang tha mal pa gsum po dag la yang dag par rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is omnipresent because it engages properly with the three types of beings, friends, enemies, and neutral persons.

original: shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa'i rnam pas gsum po dag la mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa'i rnam pas gsum po dag la mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well cultivated because it becomes the same toward the three types of beings through the previously mentioned aspects.

original: rgyas par yang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par yang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
translated: It is extensive because it is pervasive.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world refers to the world of sentient beings.

original: thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i dbye bas thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i dbye bas thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with all because it is endowed with all the different types of gods, nagas, yakshas, and so on.

original: phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is in one place because it is in one direction.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: 'jig rten du zhes gsungs te snod kyi 'jig rten du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du zhes gsungs te snod kyi 'jig rten du'o //
translated: In the world, which refers to the container world.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings bzhin du mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings bzhin du mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas vast as the realm of phenomena‚Äù means that it is limitless like the realm of phenomena.

original: nam mkha'i khams bzhin du 'di la mtha' gtugs pa yod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams bzhin du 'di la mtha' gtugs pa yod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas limitless as space‚Äù means that it is limitless like space.

original: nye bar bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni sems yang dag par byas pas so //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni sems yang dag par byas pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving attained‚Äù means that it is attained by means of a well-purified mind.

original: gnas so zhes bya bas ni 'phags pa'i gnas pas so //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya bas ni 'phags pa'i gnas pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabides‚Äù means that it abides by means of the noble abodes.

original: phyogs bcur zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the ten directions‚Äù means in the ten directions.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù means that it is easy to understand.

original: sems yangs pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang dga' ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems yangs pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang dga' ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvast mind‚Äù should also be applied to compassion and joy.

original: tshad med pa dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha bzhin du mdo'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha bzhin du mdo'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: The immeasurable practices are also to be understood in the same way as the armor of the six perfections, following the sutra.

original: de ni tshad med pa'i 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid de /

translated: That is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
